=== About Me ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border: medium none ;"> <nowiki>[[File:vini-ubuntu.jpg]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[File:3-ud2.jpg]]</nowiki>

I am a Linux Systems Analyst certified by the Linux Professional Institute and Novell, editor of <nowiki>[[http://sejalivre.org|Blog Seja Livre]]</nowiki> and Webdesigner with extensive experience in WordPress. I am LoCo Team leader <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-br-sp|Ubuntu-BR-SP]]</nowiki> and member of <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-br|Ubuntu-BR]]</nowiki><<BR>>

My first experience with Linux was on Debian in 2005, been migrating to Ubuntu in 2009. Since then I have spread the philosophy of Ubuntu and shown the incredible possibilities of use of this wonderful operating system.

=== Working On ===
* I have widespread and encouraged Ubuntu on my <nowiki>[[http://sejalivre.org|blog]]</nowiki> (which today has more than 4,000 unique visits per day);
* I have been helping new users of Ubuntu in LoCo Team <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-br-sp|Ubuntu-BR-SP]]</nowiki>
* Helping on translations and reporting bugs on Saucy Salamander and Trust Tahr.
* Coordinate the organization of the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/ubuntu-br/2303-ubuntu-day-são-paulo/|Ubuntu Day São Paulo - Brazil]]</nowiki> and other versions of the Ubuntu Day arround São Paulo state.
* I join the development team of <nowiki>[[http://www.dct.eb.mil.br/index.php/ubuntu-dct|Ubuntu DCT]]</nowiki>, which is a version of Ubuntu for the Brazilian Army, and coordinate the Brazilian Army`s Free Software Migration Plan in the state of São Paulo - Brazil.

=== What's Next? ===
* Continue supporting and helping Brazilian Ubuntu users;<<BR>>
* Review more Brazilian Portuguese translations at Launchpad;<<BR>>
* Continue writing posts about Ubuntu on blog;<<BR>>
* Continue the local distribution of CDs (now sent to LoCo teams) and ISO images;<<BR>>
* Make LoCo Team <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-br-sp|Ubuntu-BR-SP]]</nowiki> a better group and bring more peoples to the team;<<BR>>
* Continue Ubuntu leading to more people and organizations;<<BR>>
* Continue organizing future editions of the Ubuntu Day arround my country;<<BR>>
